sect2.title: Possible Extensions
sect2.para:
Here are some ideas that could be utilized in future development of pluggable module framework:
Improve Pluggable Module Manager so that it can handle also pluggable modules written in another language than Java (e.g. in Jython). We didn't implement this because we didn't have ideas of pluggable modules that would be easy to write let's say in Jython and unadequately hard to write in Java (this is not case of tasks).
Pluggable Module Manager (and BEEN as a whole) could be ported to some dynamic module platform such as OSGi. It would probably make BEEN components a bit more loosely coupled. Nevertheless, there is no proof for this claim and Pluggable Module Manager has now features that are more than satisfactory for our purposes. Next, this would need repackaging of all BEEN to OSGi packages, that are incompatible with BEEN .bpk packages.
